Text.Value: He called you Balduran?
Try to scream.
Enough!
My father sent me - Duke Ulder Ravengard. We need your help.
*The spirit pauses, and you feel the Astral Prism stir. Ansur senses the Emperor's presence within it.*
I am the Heart of the Gate. I am The One Who Roars.

EditorData.SFXTags: [KrisB] Eye light removed from player, sparks in Ansur's. Ground rumbling
EditorData.VFXTags: [KrisB] Eye light removed from player, sparks in Ansur's. Debris falling from cave ceiling

Text.Value: You had every choice. You were becoming illithid. I offered you merciful death; you chose to fight.
I am Ansur, Heart of the Gate - butchered in flesh, risen in spirit.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The words come not from the dragon, but the player. The player's lips move, but the voice is the dragon's. It is a great, booming voice, terrible but with a certain soothing warmth

Text.Value: Let my bones rise and the storms gather. Witness, Balduran - the final tempest has come.
*Disbelief and resentment rise within you, only to be stopped at your mouth. The wyrm has claimed you, and speaks through you.*
Once, long ago.
A touching reunion. Now how about letting me go?
*A deep sigh resonates within you. The torrent stills, only disturbed by the dragon's next words.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [GERRY]Player Escape Attempt, Turns around > Stumbles away > He's Picked up and Flipped around into Possession pose (Speak with dead)
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The present players are raised into the air and turned on their back in the style of a speak with dead. They hover above the ground.

Text.Value: *Ansur binds you despite your best efforts - yet thought flows effortlessly between you.*
Ansur was my friend.
*Stillness. Ansur's consciousness hovers just above yours, searching, seeing.*
We crossed the Calim together and sailed Yal Tengri. We built a city by the sea.

EditorData.NodeContext: Calim (KAL-im) = a desert; Yal Tengri (YAL TEN-GREE) = an icy sea

Text.Value: This time, you will not escape it!
I never shy away from a challenge.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [GERRY] Skeletal Dragon Rising-Bones shake and rattle as he ‘assembles’, looming over player, terrifying and menacingPlayer: Comes to after being dazed from being struck by lightening. Turns around on floor to witness. Looking up at dragon from the floor in shock (idling). See Storyboard and kickoff doc for ref.
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
The energy flows into the dragon bones on the ground. Ghostly lights spark inside the eye sockets of the skull.

JLatino: CUT "A skeletal dragon assembles and rises, looming over the players, terrifying in its presence."

Text.Value: This is tiresome. I passed your trials, dragon, I deserve a reward.
And now you bring your thrall before me. How far has the great Balduran fallen?
*The next words that spill from your mouth are not yours, but the wyrm's.*
*Your lips resist, then yield - Ansur's thoughts flow out of you as if they were your own.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
The space changes - a vision space. The Emperor appears in flesh. When the player speaks

JLatino: CUT ", we see Ansur's animated bones behind."
EditorData.SFXTags: [KrisB] Box active, Emperor appears, Dark dome surrounds the area
EditorData.VFXTags: [KrisB] Box active, Emperor appears, Dark dome surrounds the area

Text.Value: Dear Ansur -
*Ansur wends his way through your mind like an unstoppable river. Your body is unmoving, yet thought flows effortlessly between you.*
*Your throat thickens with stifled air. Ansur's thoughts flow out of you as if they were your own.*
I gave you everything, Balduran - and you repaid me in slaughter. It is time I return the favour.

EditorData.SFXTags: [KrisB] Dark Dome dissipates and so does the Emperor
EditorData.VFXTags: [KrisB] Dark Dome dissipates and so does the Emperor

Text.Value: Answer me, faessi: why have you come?
I'm beginning to ask myself the same question.
*The Emperor stirs in the Astral Prism, then in you - calm, curious, and detached.*
Answer the question, mind flayer. You owe it to both of us.
Thrall?! I am no thrall.
Friend, yes - and more.
I mean you no harm. Just let me go.
I am no thrall, Ansur. I've come for your aid.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [GERRY] Crouch down > Pick up helmet from a table > Stand up > Inspect helmet. Helmet rises about 10cms and shakes in air above hands> Lightning strikes helmet > Player sent flying backwards > Helmet drops
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext:
The player approached the dragon bones in the Wyrmway. 

JLatino: CUT "As they get close, or click on the helm of balduran (TBD), the helm trmbles, and spiritual energy flows from it."

Text.Value: Balduran? No. I don't believe it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Discovering that the mind flayer could be what's left of Baldur's Gate's founding hero

Text.Value: *The dragon's spirit floods your mind and memory in a great torrent of power. He is with you, he is within you, he is you.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [GERRY] Dragon opens mouth to transfer spiritual energy > Player reaction in receiving it >  Long Idle of player (similar to Speak with Dead)
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: A rush of spiritual energy flies from the dragon's mouth and into the player's mouth. This ribbon of energy connects them throughout.

Text.Value: Satisfaction? No. You left me no choice.
Ansur. It's been too long.
Ux Bahamuti. My words aren't meant for you - they're meant for him.
Vrak. My words aren't meant for you - they're meant for him.
Have you come to dance on my bones, Balduran? Was slaying me not satisfaction enough?

EditorData.NodeContext: With an undercurrent of melancholy, but a slight edge in this line.

Text.Value: Balduran.
Search your mind for what possesses it.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [GERRY] Player falls from hovering and tumbles/rolls away from the Dragon > Stand up (w/ struggle) > Look up at dragon
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The players are released from paralysis and drop to the ground with a thud. They scramble to their feet just in time for battle to begin.

Text.Value: Your presence has stirred me, as it ever did. I am awakened.
Faessi? I conquered your trials, great wyrm. I am no coward.
You two know each other?
Bite back the words that aren't yours.
Until you killed me.

EditorData.NodeContext: With an undercurrent of melancholy and bitterness.

Text.Value: We knew each other once - long ago.
A name I once answered to. A name I did not expect to hear again, least of all from the mouth of an old friend.
I thought the trials would lead me to treasure.
Will someone please explain to me what's going on?

Synopsis:
Player attempted to take the Helmet of Balduran, but in the process, awakened the spirit of the dragon called Ansur.

Ansur's spirit animates his fallen bones and takes control over the player and speaks using their mouths. He is speaking to the Emperor, who you discover is actually Balduran, Baldur's Gate's founder. Ansur and the Emperor discuss their past, and the dragon attacks the players, convinced they are the emperor's thralls.
